100000 years ago. The villages of Portela and Bangaeria are effectively joined as they sprawl for a kilometer or two on the main road that crosses the crater.

The villagers live from the agriculture in the rich volcanic soil of the crater. Grapes are used to made the excellent Fogo wine which must be tried. Apples, pears, peaches and figs are also grown.

. The pickup leaves from his downtown office around 11:00 for the 2-hour journey (500$).

Aluguers are around the same price but take around three hours due to frequent stops.

Getting back to São Filipe is similar with Patrick's pickup leaving at 08:30. Aluguers leave earlier.

The highlight of a trip to Fogo is climbing the Pico de Fogo. Despite the imposing slopes, the climb is possible for anyone of moderate fitness who doesn't mind a bit a rock scrambling.

A sturdy pair of sneakers is essential - no sandals. High-top hiking shoes or even walking sticks are not required but might be appreciated. Don't forget sunscreen and water.

Ideally you will want to spend two nights in Chã das Caldeiras. Take a short walk in the afternoon and arrange a guide for the trip up the peak the following day.

Guides charge around 4500$ for a group, so you might want to ask around to share the cost.
